reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You can't beat the location of this bed & breakfast. It is located a few blocks from the Historic Old Town Plaza and several excellent museums, yet is located in a quiet neighborhood of residential homes. The owner, Nancy, is friendly and helpful and even made us some muffins to take with us when we had an early departure. We stayed in the Garden suite which was incredibly spacious and has an adjacent private sitting room filled with books, photos and mementos from Nancy's life. The bedroom features a wood beam ceiling, a kiva fireplace, and opens up to a pretty courtyard which is also where we ate breakfast. The Old Town Bed & Breakfast in Albuquerque is a delightful place to stay and an excellent value for money!
reviews.title: Delightful Bed & Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a lovely bed and breakfast, and the hostess, Nancy, is as lovely as the other reviews have said. There are now hairdryers in the rooms - a previous reviewer commented on that lack!
reviews.title: A warm welcoming b & b

reviews.text: Very comfortable, very convenient for Old Town, and also easy to use the nearby Rapid Ride buses for other parts of the town.
reviews.title: A perfect spot for the start of exploring Albuquerque!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you have a car, don't miss a trip to Acoma Pueblo, sometimes called Sky City. And a trip in the cable car to Sandia Peak.
reviews.title: Close to Old Town but oh so quiet.

reviews.text: On our annual "sisters" reunion (or "sisters and daughters/nieces" reunion) we started out at Nancy's Old Town B&B and were ever so glad we did! It was not only beautiful inside and out, but was so close to Old Town that the sisters (in their 80's) had no problem walking to and fro the B&B and Old Town. Nancy was ever so gratious and her meals were to die for! I still would love her recipe for the souffle we had in the morning...Yummy. And the strawberries. And the muffins. We took up the entire B&B and loved all the rooms. With the door open downstairs, the air flowed in genly and was swirled around by the lovely ceiling fan.
reviews.title: Splendid B&B

likes.liked: — Nancy, our hostess, had great tastes in decor, recommendations and was an excellent cook.

reviews.text: The Old Town B&B is easy to find, very convenient to the airport (we were not bothered by plane noise), and a short walk to the shops, restaurants, and fun around the Old Town Plaza. It’s also very close to Albuquerque’s great museums. The residential street it is on is very quiet, and except for the cheerful growls of little dogs playing out of sight over the garden wall, birdsong, and the zzzzz of humming birds, it’s as peaceful a place to lay your head as ever there was.
reviews.title: One of the best B & B's I've ever had the pleasure to stay in!

likes.liked: — Convenient, comfortable, great location, great value, extremely restful, and our lovely hostess
likes.disliked: — Um, the bed was a little old and creaky, but clean and comfortable enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Among many great things about this B&B is that it has only two rooms – one capacious and one cozy – and my traveling companion and I took over the whole place for two nights. We were both exceptionally comfortable, she in the little upstairs Aerie and I in the Garden Suite on the main floor. My friend liked the Aerie especially because of the excellent cross-ventilation at night. I liked the Garden Room because it opened directly into the lovely patio where we could swing in the evening coolness and have breakfast al fresco in the morning.
reviews.title: A Perfect Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The attractively decorated Garden Suite comprises two large connected rooms, one with king bed and one, furnished as a sitting area, with a fold-out couch. The bathroom has a Mexican-tiled tub (the Aerie has a similarly pretty shower stall). Hot water comes up quickly and is abundant; the pressure is adequate (though I’ve seen better shower heads), the towels are large and soft; shampoo, conditioner, and hand lotion are supplied in environmentally-friendly refillable bottles, and the soap is a gentle, mildly fruity glycerin tablet. There are an electric kettle and packets of cocoa and tea bags in the room, and my friend and I each found two bottles of ice cold water, hard candies, and a generous portion of freshly baked snack cake awaiting our arrival. In the Garden Room there are a window air conditioner in the bedroom, and ceiling fans in both sections for ventilation (it’s not safe to leave the patio door open at night because the gate to the street is not locked, though during the day the screen door admits abundant light and fresh air). The bedroom a has a working fireplace (plus a real heater), a roomy antique-like armoire and decent hangers, a desk, love seat, an alarm clock and a radio/boom box. The sitting area has bookshelves full of southwestern literature (Silko, Hillerman, Kingsolver, others) that I wish I’d had time to read; the lighting is good for reading and everything else. So nice!
reviews.title: Old Town B & B - terrific!

reviews.text: There is off-street parking under a shady ramada. Both the parking and lodging feel perfectly safe and secure.
reviews.title: Great location for kids

likes.disliked: — no divider for privacy between bedroom & sitting room/fold-out sofa, no wireless

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What neither the Garden nor the Aerie rooms have: no hairdryer, no TV, and no phone. BYO hairdryer; our cell phone signals were strong. The Aerie is not accessible to the mobility-impaired. Those who can handle a step (there’s a critical one between bathroom and bedroom!) and negotiate the tub for bathing could enjoy the Garden room. And one important reminder: Nancy does not accept credit cards, so be prepared to pay your balance by check or cash.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this lovely B&B in July '06 for one night on our way to a wedding in Santa Fe. The property was much more than we expected. The property is located in an established residential area of pueblo style homes. Our hostess, Nancy, was delightful, warm & friendly. We stayed in the 'Garden Suite' and it was spotless, well-appointed and spacious. There was a beautiful viga beam ceiling and kiva fireplace in the bedroom & a lovely sitting room/library with lots of books to read (NOTE: no in-room tv or phone,which was ok with us.....there was a nice cd player/radio). The bath was nice too with pretty Mexican tilework. The suite is located off of a nice courtyard with a fountain, porch swing and patio area for dining. The weather was beautiful and we ate breakfast in the outdoor patio/courtyard area. Breakfast was delicious and ample with fresh fruit, homemade bread/muffins, a yummy omelet and freshly squeezed orange juice. The location is wonderful with the Albuquerque Exploratorium/Nature Museum at the end of the block and only a few blocks from the 'Old Town Plaza' area. We had a wonderful, relaxing stay and would recommend this lovely inn to anyone!
reviews.title: Lovely property in nice area near Old Town

likes.liked: — Very spacious, nice and clean. Great location. Great breakfast.

reviews.title: Great little B&B
reviews.text: We were very pleased with our stay. Our room was private, comfortable and clean. Breakfast was wonderfully prepared, ample and delicious. Nancy, the hostess, is friendly and helpful. The house is very close to Old Town and is in a very nice neighborhood. Would recommend to anyone.

My three sisters and I have just returned from a road trip across Arizona and New Mexico. Our trip ended in Albuquerque and we booked The Old Town Bed & Breakfast because we would be near to the airport for our flight the next day. What a surprise when we arrived. A lovely Adobe style house, Nancy had a beautiful big bedroom for us, tastfully decorated, with a lovely Kiva fireplace it was great. There was cookies and sweets on the table and bottled water, the bathroom was nicely decorated and spotless. Nancy couldn't have been more attentive and helpful, she cooked us a lovely breakfast and chatted to us about our trip. We were sorry we only stayed there for one night, it would have been lovely to stay there longer, I would highly recommend The old Town B&B
reviews.title: Nancy is the best hostess
